title: REST API doesn't start even when `--rest-api-enabled=true`
body:
### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. Run the `consensys/teku:latest` Docker image with the following flags:
  ```
            "--network=/kurtosis-enclave-data/services/cl-client-0_1639633527/genesis-config.yml",
            "--initial-state=/kurtosis-enclave-data/services/cl-client-0_1639633527/genesis.ssz",
            "--data-path=/opt/teku/consensus-data",
            "--data-storage-mode=PRUNE",
            "--p2p-enabled=true",
            "--eth1-endpoints=http://70.165.48.4:8545",
            "--Xee-endpoint=http://70.165.48.4:8545",
            "--p2p-advertised-ip=70.165.48.5",
            "--rest-api-enabled=true",
            "--rest-api-docs-enabled=true",
            "--rest-api-interface=0.0.0.0",
            "--rest-api-port=4000",
            "--rest-api-host-allowlist=\"*\"",
            "--data-storage-non-canonical-blocks-enabled=true",
            "--log-destination=CONSOLE"
  ```

**Expected behavior:**
The REST API become savailable on port 4000.

**Actual behavior:**
The following log message is printed:
```
2021-12-16 05:53:18.595 INFO  - validator-api-enabled is false, not starting rest api.
```

**Frequency:** 100% of the time

### Versions (Add all that apply)
Docker image: `consensys/teku:latest` as of 2021-12-15
Software version:
```
teku/v21.12.2/linux-x86_64/-eclipseadoptium-openjdk64bitservervm-java-17
```
Docker Version:
```
Client:
 Cloud integration: v1.0.20
 Version:           20.10.10
 API version:       1.41
 Go version:        go1.16.9
 Git commit:        b485636
 Built:             Mon Oct 25 07:43:15 2021
 OS/Arch:           darwin/amd64
 Context:           default
 Experimental:      true

Server: Docker Engine - Community
 Engine:
  Version:          20.10.10
  API version:      1.41 (minimum version 1.12)
  Go version:       go1.16.9
  Git commit:       e2f740d
  Built:            Mon Oct 25 07:41:30 2021
  OS/Arch:          linux/amd64
  Experimental:     false
 containerd:
  Version:          1.4.11
  GitCommit:        5b46e404f6b9f661a205e28d59c982d3634148f8
 runc:
  Version:          1.0.2
  GitCommit:        v1.0.2-0-g52b36a2
 docker-init:
  Version:          0.19.0
  GitCommit:        de40ad0
* Cloud VM, type, size: [Amazon Web Services I3-large]
```

### Additional Information
I tried searching through the flags & codebase for a way to enable the validator API, but no luck.

Hi @mieubrisse, 
"validator api" and "rest api" (beacon api) are two different things.
If you see
```
2021-12-16 05:53:18.595 INFO  - validator-api-enabled is false, not starting rest api.
```
doesn't mean that rest api are not started.

can you search in startup logs something like ".... INFO  - Listening on http: ..." ?

and can you actually try to connect to 4000?

Thanks for the quick response @tbenr , you're right! I was giving it 10s to start, was getting connection refused during those 10s, and was assuming that the displayed log message was the issue. I upped that to 2m timeout and I do indeed get a "Listning on http://localhost:4000" and connecting works - thank you!
